org.jpasecurity.security.authentication.jaas

Class AbstractLoginModule<P extends Principal>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpasecurity.security.authentication.jaas.AbstractLoginModule<P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoginModule

    public abstract class AbstractLoginModule<P extends Principal>
extends Object
implements LoginModule
    This class can be subclassed to implement a JAAS login module that is based on user name / password authentication.
    Author:
    Arne Limburg

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractLoginModule() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean abort()
      This method is called by the JAAS engine to indicate that some other login module prevents authentication.
      protected abstract P authenticate(String userName, String password)
      Implementations of this method try to authenticate the user with the specified user name and password.
      protected boolean canLogout()
      This implementation always returns true.
      boolean commit()
      This method is called by the JAAS engine to actually establish the authentication.
      protected Principal[] getAdditionalPrincipals()
      This method may provide additional principals for the currently authenticated principal such as roles or groups.
      P getCurrentPrincipal()
      returns the currently authenticated principal or null if no user is yet authenticated.

      • AbstractLoginModule

        public AbstractLoginModule()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public final void initialize(Subject subject,
              CallbackHandler callbackHandler,
              Map<String,?> sharedState,
              Map<String,?> options)
        This method is called by the JAAS engine on initialization. If you want to intercept the initialization process, you can override postConstruct(Subject, CallbackHandler, Map, Map).
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface LoginModule

      • postConstruct

        protected void postConstruct(Subject subject,
                 CallbackHandler callbackHandler,
                 Map<String,?> sharedState,
                 Map<String,?> options)
        This implementation does nothing. However you can override this method to get informed about the initialization of this login module.

      • getCurrentPrincipal

        public P getCurrentPrincipal()
        returns the currently authenticated principal or null if no user is yet authenticated.
        Returns:
        the authenticated principal or null

      • login

        public final boolean login()
                    throws LoginException
        This method is called by the JAAS engine on login. It calls authenticate(String, String) which has to be implemented by subclasses of this class.
        Specified by:
        login in interface LoginModule
        Throws:
        LoginException

      • authenticate

        protected abstract P authenticate(String userName,
             String password)
                                             throws LoginException
        Implementations of this method try to authenticate the user with the specified user name and password. If authentication cannot be established this method either may return null or throw a LoginException.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        Returns:
        the authenticated principal or null if authentication could not be established
        Throws:
        LoginException - if some error occurs

      • logout

        public final boolean logout()
                     throws LoginException
        This method is called by the JAAS engine on logout. If you want to intercept the logout process you may override canLogout().
        Specified by:
        logout in interface LoginModule
        Throws:
        LoginException

      • canLogout

        protected boolean canLogout()
        This implementation always returns true. Subclasses may override this method to do cleanup on logout and only return true, if all cleanup succeeds.
        Returns:
        true if the current authenticated user can be logged out, false otherwise

      • commit

        public final boolean commit()
                     throws LoginException
        This method is called by the JAAS engine to actually establish the authentication. It calls getAdditionalPrincipals() to enable subclasses to provide additional principals such as roles.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface LoginModule
        Throws:
        LoginException

      • getAdditionalPrincipals

        protected Principal[] getAdditionalPrincipals()
        This method may provide additional principals for the currently authenticated principal such as roles or groups. If you want to provide additional roles for the currently authenticated principal, you can use getCurrentPrincipal() to actually get the currently authenticated principal and return instances of RolePrincipal in this method.

        This implementation returns an empty array.

      • abort

        public boolean abort()
              throws LoginException
        This method is called by the JAAS engine to indicate that some other login module prevents authentication. This implementation calls login().
        Specified by:
        abort in interface LoginModule
        Throws:
        LoginException
